hepfile package¶

Submodules¶

hepfile.read module¶

hepfile.read.get_nentries(filename)¶

Get the number of entries in the file.

hepfile.read.load(filename=None, verbose=False, desired_datasets=None, subset=None)¶

Reads all, or a subset of the data, from the HDF5 file to fill a data dictionary. Returns an empty dictionary to be filled later with select events.

Parameters

  • **filename** (string) – Name of the input file

  • **verbose** (boolean) – True if debug output is required

  • **desired_datasets** (list) – Datasets to be read from input file

  • **subset** (int) – Number of events to be read from input file

Returns

Selected data from HDF5 file

event (dict): An empty event dictionary to be filled by individual events

Return type

**ourdata (dict)

hepfile.read.unpack(event, data, n=0)¶

Fills the event dictionary with selected events.

Parameters

  • **event** (dict) – Event dictionary to be filled

  • **data** (dict) – Data dictionary used to fill the event dictionary

hepfile.write module¶

hepfile.write.clear_event(data)¶

Clears the data from the data dictionary - should the name of the function change?

Parameters

**data** (dict) – The dictionary to be cleared

hepfile.write.convert_dict_to_string_data(dictionary)¶

Converts data dictionary to a string

Parameters

**dictionary** (dict) – Dictionary to be converted to a string

Returns

String representation of the dataset

Return type

mydataset (string)

hepfile.write.convert_list_and_key_to_string_data(datalist, key)¶

Converts data dictionary to a string

Parameters

**datalist** (list) – A list to be saved as a string.

Returns

We will assume that this will be unpacked as a dictionary,

and this will be the key for the list in that dictionary.

Return type

key (string)

hepfile.write.create_dataset(data, datasets, group=None, dtype=None)¶

Adds a dataset to a group in a dictionary. If the group does not exist, it will be created.

Parameters

  • **data** (dict) – Dictionary that contains the group

  • **datasets** (list) – Dataset to be added to the group (This doesn’t have to be a list)

  • **group** (string) – Name of group the dataset will be added to. None by default

  • **dtype** (type) – The data type. None by default - I don’t think this is every used

Returns

If the group is None

Return type

-1

hepfile.write.create_group(data, groupname, counter=None)¶

Adds a group in the dictionary

Parameters

  • **data** (dict) – Dictionary to which the group will be added

  • **groupname** (string) – Name of the group to be added

  • **counter** (string) – Name of the counter key. None by default

hepfile.write.create_single_event(data)¶

Creates an event dictionary that will be used to collect data and then packed into the the master data dictionary.

Parameters

**data** (dict) – Data dictionary that will hold all the data from the events.

Returns

The new event dictionary with keys and no event information

Return type

event (dict)

hepfile.write.initialize()¶

Creates an empty data dictionary

Returns

An empty data dictionary

Return type

data (dict)

hepfile.write.pack(data, event)¶

Takes the data from an event and packs it into the data dictionary, intelligently, so that it can be stored and extracted efficiently. (This is analagous to the ROOT TTree::Fill() member function.

Parameters

  • **data** (dict) – Data dictionary to hold the entire dataset.

  • **event** (dict) – Event to be packed into data.

hepfile.write.write_to_file(filename, data, comp_type=None, comp_opts=None, force_single_precision=True)¶

Writes the selected data to an HDF5 file

Parameters

  • **filename** (string) – Name of output file

  • **data** (dictionary) – Data to be written into output file

  • **comp_type** (string) – Type of compression

  • **force_single_precision** (boolean) – True if data should be written in single precision

Returns

File to which the data has been written

Return type

hdoutfile (HDF5)

Module contents¶

A file description modeled after the ROOT analysis toolkit and common use-cases in High Energy Physics. Implemented in HDF5, hepfile stands for Heterogeneous Entries in Parallel-file.

Usage
